info.title: PIM Product Service API (DRAFT)
info.description:
Services for retrieving product data.

API Versions

  • This reference document applies only for V1 version of the APIs.

get.description: Useful for checking status API
at least one parameter should select to fetch the product entity data

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: region in which the product takes place

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: select whether to return a simple entity or a more complete one.

get.description: at least one parameter should select to fetch the product entity data

parameters.name: seasonId
parameters.description: id of a season of the product

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: name of an event of the product

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: name of an event of the product

parameters.name: productCode
parameters.description: select whether to return a simple entity or a more complete one.

get.description: Useful for retrieving seasons
Useful for retrieving a season by id
at least one parameter should select to fetch the Event entity data

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: eventName used to match the event(s)

parameters.name: seasonId
parameters.description: id of a season of the product

get.description: Useful for retrieving event associated marketing content
Useful for retrieving venue associated marketing content

parameters.name: venueType
parameters.description: venueType used to match the event(s)

parameters.name: propertyId
parameters.description: id of the physical location containing the venues

Product.description: Previously known as ShowEvent - working progress

201.description: A show has been successfully created.

400.description: ERROR: unsupported value formats resulting in bad request. Refer 'Error' in Models for schema.

404.description: ERROR: product with given ID not found (update apis).

500.description: ERROR: Unexpected service errors or failure to connect to source systems. Refer 'Error' in Models for schema.

x-mgm-channel.description: Returns the value as received in the request headers.

x-mgm-source.description: Returns the value as received in the request headers.

x-mgm-correlation-id.description: If present in the request headers, returns the same value or the one created in the API.

x-mgm-transaction-id.description: Returns the value as received in the request headers.

channel.name: x-mgm-channel
channel.description: Channel from where the request has originated

source.name: x-mgm-source
source.description: Source invoking the API. GSE uses concept of channel to different various channels/sources for reporting/diagnosis. Service will identify channel to use based on source value.

correlationId.name: x-mgm-correlation-id
correlationId.description: Correlation Id is used to trace end to end transactions. The id is optional and service will create one if not passed by clients, pass it to downstream applications and send it back in the response headers. Clients are encouraged to set this parameter if the correlation between different APIs needs to be tracked.

transactionId.name: x-mgm-transaction-id
transactionId.description: This field represents the transaction id. Clients are required to generate this unique identifier and pass it in the request, the same will be passed in the response headers.

info-type.name: info-type
info-type.description: Response's level of detail, from a list of matching entities to full content. Possible values are `list`, `basic`, `detail`. For some content types, `basic` and `detail` are equivalent.

destination.name: destination
destination.description: Region code or property ID. Region codes: `all`, `all-las-vegas`, `all-mississippi`, `all-detroit`, `all-maryland`. A property ID may be a GUID (e.g. `065be2ce-bc50-49d9-9129-ba0554816554`) or a readable string (e.g. `t-mobile-arena`).

modifiedSince.name: modifiedSince
modifiedSince.description: Limit results to items modified since the provided date-time. Provide a value of milliseconds since the Unix epoch (Jan 1, 1970) in UTC.

search.name: search
search.description: Pass keyword(s) to this parameter to limit the results using a full text search.
